sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"敢于冒险"之意。
means: venture ： 指冒风险试一试，或指有礼貌的反抗或反对。
chance ： 指碰运气、冒风险试试。
dare ： 可与venture换用，但语气较强，着重挑战或违抗。
hazard ： 主要指冒险作出某个选择，隐含碰运气意味。
risk ： 指不顾个人安危去干某事，侧重主动承担风险。

sentence.Network_en: When you venture outside, you are in for a surprise.
sentence.Network_cn: 你外出探险时，定会遇上意想不到之事。

sentence.Network_en: People are afraid to venture out for fear of sniper attacks.
sentence.Network_cn: 由于害怕狙击手，人们不敢冒险外出。

sentence.Network_en: Disney will retain a 51 percent controlling interest in the venture.
sentence.Network_cn: 迪斯尼将保留该项目51%的控股权。

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)you can't expect to achieve anything if you never take any risks
By mere chance or fortune; at random.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'adventure', also 'risk the loss of'): shortening of adventure

entry.tran: 风险项目（或活动);冒险事业
entry.def: A venture is a project or activity which is new, exciting, and difficult because it involves the risk of failure.
If you venture somewhere, you go somewhere that might be dangerous.

example.ex: People are afraid to venture out for fear of sniper attacks...
example.tran: 由于害怕狙击手，人们不敢冒险外出。

example.ex: Few Europeans who had ventured beyond the Himalayas had returned to tell the tale.
example.tran: 少数几个冒险翻越了喜马拉雅山的欧洲人回来后讲述了这个故事。

entry.tran: 斗胆提出（问题）;冒险发表（陈述）
entry.def: If you venture a question or statement, you say it in an uncertain way because you are afraid it might be stupid or wrong.

example.tran: “那么你就是列奥的女朋友了？”他大胆问道。

example.ex: He ventured that plants draw part of their nourishment from the air...
example.tran: 他大胆提出植物从空气中吸收部分养分的观点。

entry.def: If you venture to do something that requires courage or is risky, you do it.

example.ex: 'Don't ask,' he said, whenever Ginny ventured to raise the subject.
example.tran: 每当金尼鼓起勇气提起这个话题时，他就说“不要问”。

entry.def: If you venture into an activity, you do something that involves the risk of failure because it is new and different.

example.ex: He enjoyed little success when he ventured into business.
example.tran: 他冒险涉足商界后几乎没有取得什么成功。

means.word_mean: 1. any venturesome undertaking especially one with an uncertain outcome
2. an investment that is very risky but could yield great profits;

sentences.sentence: "he knew the stock was a speculation when he bought it"

means.word_mean: 3. a commercial undertaking that risks a loss but promises a profit
1. proceed somewhere despite the risk of possible dangers;

sentences.sentence: "We ventured into the world of high-tech and bought a supercomputer"

means.word_mean: 2. put forward, of a guess, in spite of possible refutation;

sentences.sentence: "I am guessing that the price of real estate will rise again"
"I cannot pretend to say that you are wrong"
"I will stake my good reputation for this"

Sentence.sentence: Why is Google undertaking such a venture?

sentences.cn: 不入虎穴, 焉得虎子。

sentences.en: I won't venture a step farther.
He ventured to speak to her.
Men ventured their lives in war.
sentences.cn: 人们在战争中冒着生命的危险。

sentences.en: He ventured all his money on the final try.
sentences.cn: 他以他所有的钱做最后的孤注一掷。

jushi.english: Don't venture too near the edge of the well,you might fall in.
jushi.chinese: 不要冒险走近井边,你可能会掉进去的。

jushi.english: Men venture their lives in space exploration.
jushi.chinese: 人们冒着生命危险从事太空探索。
